duck: Non-local variable - In programming language theory, a non-local variable is a variable that is not defined in the local scope.

milestones: Prayer does not help heart patients, study finds

wiki.text: 'Nonlocal' may refer to: * Nonlocality (disambiguation) * Non-local variable ** nonlocal, a statement in Python 3.* that causes the listed identifiers to the previously bound variable in the nearest enclosing scope ([http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3104/ Access to Names in Outer Scopes])
wiki.title: nonlocal
